str2: A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: Intent, constant, strenuous, intense; met: earnest, zealous. From ekteino; intent.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To veil, hide, conceal, envelop. Akin to klepto and krupto; to cover up.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.
